file_content.text: The Republic's back to being blind, deaf and mute like everyone else on Hoth.
Those explosives I gave you should be enough to take out the comm array.
This was supposed to be a simple assignment. You'd think disrupting enemy communications on Hoth would be easy, right?
The broadcasting range here is terrible. Better off just shouting.
The weather alone makes transmitting a logistical nightmare. Figured my work was all but done for me.
And here I was afraid I'd sent you to your death, pitting you against Aegis Company like that. Felt bad.
Didn't count on the Republic building a giant communications array to boost their transmissions. Solved all their broadcasting problems overnight!
Thought maybe we could tap into the array, piggyback the signal to boost our own transmissions. But the encryption's too good.
Pretty much helpless at this point. Weather's so bad, we'd need a comm array of our own just to transmit a decent jamming signal.
Best option is to blow the array up, but Aegis Company is garrisoned there. Probably be safer attacking Coruscant with a freighter.
Aegis Company hasn't lost an objective in fifteen years. They'll defend the comm array to their dying breaths--or ours.
We've got to disrupt the Republic's communications or they will win this planet. But that means getting past Aegis Company.
I'm running out of options, here.
That seems too easy.
The array's antennae amplify and focus the Republic's comm signals--cuts right through all the environmental interference.
How will you stop them?
Tough luck.
Those Aegis troopers are masters of tactical defense. They've held back attacking forces ten times their size with minimal casualties.
You destroyed the comm array? That--that's incredible!
We should do that.
That array probably cost millions of credits. Doesn't quite gel with the Empire's "minimal effort, maximum gains" strategy on Hoth.
Then you've failed.
Yes, my superiors are not going to be happy about this one.
Then a suicide run like this was tailor made for you.
I may have underestimated the Republic's resourcefulness, yes.
Can't help you. [Refuse quest]
That's what I figured.
I already had the demolitions team rig up some charges. Just plant these on the array and let the explosions handle the rest.
That could be fun.
I look forward to it.
Give me the details.
And here I was afraid I'd sent you to your deaths, pitting you against Aegis Company like that. Felt bad.
That comm array was a huge investment for the Republic. Can't imagine they'll be eager to build another. Good work.
That's your problem, not mine.
Why do you say that?
This job won't come free.
You were careless.
I can pay. Seems worth it to level a multimillion credit structure.
